N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.5 - Specifications of uniform traffic ticket

State Regulations

Uniform traffic tickets conforming to the following
specifications may be issued for traffic violations occurring prior to January
1, 1970, and must be used for traffic violations occurring on and after January
1, 1970. No variations from the prescribed specifications shall be permitted
unless prior written approval is obtained from the commissioner. (a) It shall be a multi-copy packet, with
interleaved carbons, conforming to the following: (1)

Each part shall be between 4 and 41/4
inches wide and between 73/4 and 8 inches long, plus a suitable stub for
binding. (2)

Each carbon shall be
of sufficient size to provide reproduction of all necessary information on all
copies. (b) It shall
consist of five parts. An enforcement agency may, however, request permission
from the commissioner to use a uniform traffic ticket containing more or less
than five parts. The commissioner may grant such a deviation in his discretion, and may prescribe specific conditions under which such a packet may be
used. (c) The paper in each part
shall be 12- or 13-pound sulfite bond paper. Part V may, at the option of the
enforcement agency, be on card stock. (d) The carbons shall be one-time blue or
black, for pencil use, of a quality which will provide readable copies on all
parts. (e) The various parts of the
packet shall be of the colors prescribed in section
91.7
of this Part. (f) The name of the enforcement agency must
appear on the top of each part of the packet, to the left of the serial number. It may be printed thereon or, in the case of a small enforcement agency, it may
be supplied by the use of a rubber stamp. On part I, such name may be black or
red. On all other parts, such name may be black or a color resulting from the
print or stamp on part I and the carbon interleaves. (g) All material on each part, except where
otherwise indicated, shall be printed in black. (h) The size of type used in each part, except where a definite size is otherwise indicated, shall be approximately as
shown on the forms set forth in section
91.7
of this Part. (i) Packets may be glued or stapled in sets
of 10, 25 or 50 to a book, or may be issued in single sets for use in special
holders. (j) Traffic violations
bureaus. (1)

In municipalities having a
traffic violations bureau established pursuant to the provisions of section
370
of
the General Municipal Law, the uniform traffic ticket may include the name and
location of the traffic violations bureau and the return date, in addition to
information with respect to the court. (2)

In such municipalities, the ticket may
require the appearance of the alleged violator either before the court or, if
appropriate, in the traffic violations bureau; and in relation to the required
appearance, only the applicable portions shall be completed. (3)

If the foregoing is used, appropriate
information relating to the disposition of matters in the traffic violations
bureau shall be placed on the reverse of, or attached to, part I of the
packet. Notes
